key_points: Millions globally rely on Facebook's suite of services for internet access.
Facebook, WhatsApp, Messenger, and Instagram experienced an outage caused by changes to backbone routers.
The outage lasted nearly six hours, starting around 11:40 a.m. US Eastern time.
The issue was with traffic being improperly handled by the Domain Name System (DNS).
For users in the US, the outage was mainly an inconvenience, but for users in other parts of the world, it represented a significant disruption.
Facebook is seen as synonymous with the internet in many parts of the world, making the outage akin to a large infrastructure collapse.
The outage occurred shortly after a whistleblower interview critical of Facebook aired on CBS's 60 Minutes.
Facebook is currently under an antitrust investigation in the US.
Over 3.5 billion people use Facebook's services worldwide, with India having the highest number of users.
Facebook has initiatives like Internet.org aimed at expanding internet access globally without incurring data charges.
spokespersons: Sarah Aoun (Vice President for Security, Open Technology Fund)
